keywords.name: Fly
keywords.description: This unit can ignore other models (excluding Aircraft) and terrain when moving, and can Fall Back over enemy models.

keywords.name: Lone Operative
keywords.description: Unless this model is an Aircraft, it can only be targeted by ranged attacks if the attacking model is within 12 inches.

keywords.name: Infiltrators
keywords.description: This unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9 inches from the enemy deployment zone and any enemy models.

keywords.name: Leader
keywords.description: This unit can be attached to another unit to form a single combined unit, gaining its abilities.

keywords.name: Rapid Deployment
keywords.description: Units with this keyword are designed for rapid redeployment, often allowing for special setup rules or movement.

keywords.name: Scout X
keywords.description: Before the first turn, this unit can make a Normal Move up to X inches.

keywords.name: Stealth
keywords.description: Each time a ranged attack targets this unit, the attacking model's Hit roll suffers a -1 penalty.

keywords.name: Character
keywords.description: A single model unit, often with special abilities, and typically eligible to be a Leader.

keywords.name: Chaos
keywords.description: A Faction Keyword representing forces aligned with the Ruinous Powers.

keywords.name: Daemon
keywords.description: A Faction Keyword representing creatures from the Warp.

keywords.name: Infantry
keywords.description: A unit composed of individual foot soldiers, typically able to move through terrain easily.

keywords.name: Grenades
keywords.description: This unit can make a Grenade attack once per battle during its controlling player's Shooting phase.

keywords.name: Beast
keywords.description: A unit type representing non-humanoid creatures, often with fast movement.

keywords.name: Psyker
keywords.description: A model capable of wielding psychic powers, often gaining special abilities or attacks.

keywords.name: Epic Hero
keywords.description: A unique, named Character with powerful abilities, only one of each Epic Hero can be included in an army.

keywords.name: Primarch
keywords.description: A Faction Keyword representing the powerful, legendary leaders of the Space Marine Legions or Daemon Primarchs.

keywords.name: Battle Line
keywords.description: These units represent the core of an army and can often be taken in larger numbers or fulfill specific detachment requirements.

keywords.name: Vehicle
keywords.description: A unit type representing tanks, walkers, and other armored conveyances.

keywords.name: Transport
keywords.description: A unit capable of carrying other units within it.

keywords.name: Smoke
keywords.description: A unit with this ability can use the Smoke (Aura) stratagem without spending a CP, providing a -1 to hit for ranged attacks against it.

keywords.name: Aircraft
keywords.description: A unit that represents a flying vehicle, often with unique movement and targeting rules.

keywords.name: Walker
keywords.description: A unit type representing bipedal or multi-legged combat machines.

keywords.name: Dedicated Transport
keywords.description: A Transport unit that can only carry specific units, often linked to the unit's Faction Keyword.

keywords.name: Summoned
keywords.description: Units that are brought onto the battlefield during the game, rather than being deployed at the start.

keywords.name: Mounted
keywords.description: A unit representing a model on a mount, often with enhanced movement.

keywords.name: Imperium
keywords.description: A Faction Keyword representing the various human and allied forces of the Imperium of Man.

keywords.name: Jump Pack
keywords.description: A unit equipped with a jump pack, granting enhanced movement and the ability to ignore terrain.

keywords.name: Battlesuit
keywords.description: A unit representing an armored power suit, often with unique weapon and movement capabilities.

keywords.name: Assault
keywords.description: Can be shot after advancing.

keywords.name: Deadly Demise X
keywords.description: When this model is destroyed, roll one D6. On a 6, each unit within 6" suffers 'x' mortal wounds.

keywords.name: Fights First
keywords.description: If this unit is involved in a combat, it fights before any enemy units that do not have a 'Fights First' ability, even if they charged.

keywords.name: Firing Deck X
keywords.description: When this Transport unit is chosen to shoot, up to X models embarked within it can also shoot as if they were not embarked.

keywords.name: Heavy
keywords.description: If this weapon is fired by a stationary model, its Hit roll is improved by 1.
